group_1.textRight: It looks like you've got a lot of hostility@towards that sakura tree.

group_1.textLeft: | I'm not being hostile, I'm simply assessing@its skills. |

group_1.textRight: You're watching the skills of something that@doesn't even move...
Well, I think I understand now.
Why the two Magius goaded you on.

group_1.textLeft: | To determine if that sakura tree is worthy. |

group_1.textRight: Uh-huh, you got it.
(The truth is, they probably wanted her to@gain some kind of experience.)
You're making a rare expression.
Such a rare candid shot of Sakurako.@This is gonna fetch a good price.

group_1.textLeft: | I'm concerned about the sakura tree in Sankyo.@May I leave for the day? |

group_1.textRight: No, it's only lunchtime. Don't you still have@class to go to?

group_1.textLeft: | But I won't be paying attention to any of it. |

group_1.textRight: You're gonna make your teacher cry.
Plus, we've been asked to look after you, too.
There's no way we're letting you ditch.

group_1.textLeft: | Right now, determining if that sakura tree is@worthy seems more important for everyone. |

group_1.textRight: You're really twisting that around to suit your@needs, huh?
Just try skipping class with that logic.
A truant officer is gonna catch you and phone@Mikazuki Villa.
Then Iroha is gonna get real mad at you.
Well, that's how it usually plays out.

group_1.textLeft: | What do you know about the sakura tree in@Sankyo? |

group_1.textRight: Huh?
Well, I do some reporting in that area, so I've@heard a little bit about it, but...
Hm...
A long time ago, when there was a disaster,@people used that tree to find shelter.
I think that story was set around the@beginning of the Meiji era.
Back then, Kamihama served as a major@gateway for foreign countries.
I heard that wealthy foreigners enjoyed the@culture of cherry blossom viewing.
Yeah, it's the Meiji era.
The first year of the Meiji era was 1868, so it@sounds like the tree is over 100 years old.
Sakurako, are you feeling pressured...?

group_1.textLeft: | Is there anything else you can tell me? |

group_1.textRight: I only heard a couple more things.
At that time, I was doing a little research on@famous restaurants in Kamihama.
There's a record of famous Kamihama@restaurants that served food back then...
When foreigners came for cherry blossom@viewing.
And to my surprise, that record included@the name Walnut's.

group_1.textLeft: | I can't eat the food, but I know that you@consider the food amazing. |

group_1.textRight: Sometimes it feels like it's just a Magical Girl@hangout.
But it's actually a famous restaurant that's@been around for over 100 years.

group_1.textLeft: | I won't deem that sakura tree worthy just yet,@but... |
| The more I hear about it, the more it interests@me. |
| I'm looking forward to observing it again after@school. |

group_1.textRight: Well, Iroha and the others said they weren't@in a hurry.
Just keep examining it until you're satisfied.
